revised_title: Fossil Human Skeleton Discovery in Guadaloupe
tldr: The author describes a fossilized human skeleton found in Guadaloupe, embedded in a calcareous sandstone block. The skeleton is mostly intact but missing the skull and some vertebrae. The surrounding rock is analyzed, revealing it to be similar to common sandstone, with traces of phosphoric acid and animal matter. The cause of the bones' damage and the age of the formation remain uncertain.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Human Evolution
